comment.author: 70251312@N00
70251312@N00
comment._content: The photo shows DePalma at the time of winning of the 200-mile 1914 Vanderbilt Cup race, which followed an eight-mile course over the public roads of Santa Monica, California. The date was February 26, 1914. The race took nearly four hours, and De Palma won $3,000. Story in The New York Times, February 27, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9A04E5DE163AE6...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
70251312@N00
comment._content: A bizarre footnote: Hollywood moviemaker Mack Sennett (of Keystone Comedies fame) crashed the party and himself literally got into the act, making a film with Mabel Normand and Charlie Chaplin, using the Vanderbilt Race as a backdrop. Here's a clip: www.vanderbiltcupraces.com/index.php/blog/article/1914_va...
